intro: Tanacetum matricarioides, commonly known as field chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Tanacetum matricarioides is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its aromatic properties.
